EmailTemplate.subject: 4/25/17 Webinar: Session State Caching with Spring
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hi {{lead.First Name:default=there}},
Please join us for the webinar, Session State Caching with Spring <[[https://content.pivotal.io/webinars/apr-25-session-state-caching-with-spring-webinar?utm_source=digest&utm_medium=webinars&utm_campaign=session-state-caching&utm_term=q218]]> on April 25, 2018.
Caching is a common and effective pattern for scaling applications in near real-time to handle increased load and demand. This is particularly important for cloud-native applications that serve a multitude of users, devices and even other applications. Caching can be applied in several tiers of the application and (HTTP) session state is no exception.
Spring Session offers a robust yet portable solution that avoids container lock-in without sacrificing robust features like clustering. It seamlessly allows you to plug in different provider implementations—including Spring Session for Apache Geode—to cluster session state in a reliable, consistent, and scalable manner.
Following this webinar, you will understand how session state caching using Spring Session with Apache Geode provides a reliable experience to end-users—one that is resilient to system failures, constant reconfiguration and continuous changes, in both the underlying infrastructure and applications as they evolve.
Presenters: Date: Wednesday, April 25, 2018 Time: 10:00am PDT / 1:00pm EDT
Attend <[[https://content.pivotal.io/webinars/apr-25-session-state-caching-with-spring-webinar?utm_source=digest&utm_medium=webinars&utm_campaign=session-state-caching&utm_term=q218]]>
We thank you in advance for joining us. The Pivotal Team
